qas.question: In what year was the city annexed to the German Empire?
What was the Treaty in 1871 called?
What Historian was in charge of rebuilding the municipal archives?
What year was the university founded?
What was the new name of the university when it reopened in 1872?
In what year was Rodolphe Reuss born?
What was the name of Kaiser-Wilhelms-Universitat before it was renamed?
In what year did the war begin?

context: In <a0_0><b9_0>1871<b9_0/><a0_0/>, after the end of the war, the city was annexed to the newly established German Empire as part of the Reichsland Elsass-Lothringen under the terms of the <a1_0>Treaty of Frankfurt<a1_0/>. As part of Imperial Germany, Strasbourg was rebuilt and developed on a grand and representative scale, such as the Neue Stadt, or "new city" around the present <b6_0>Place de la République<b6_0/>. Historian <a2_0>Rodolphe Reuss<a2_0/> and Art historian Wilhelm von Bode were in charge of rebuilding the municipal archives, libraries and museums. The University, founded in <a3_0><b5_0>1567<b5_0/><a3_0/> and suppressed during the French Revolution as a stronghold of <b7_0><b8_0>German<b8_0/><b7_0/> sentiment,[citation needed] was reopened in 1872 under the name <a4_0>Kaiser-Wilhelms-Universität<a4_0/>.
